str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A spectacle, vision, that which is seen. From horao; something gazed at, i.e. A spectacle.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To keep silence, be silent, either voluntarily or involuntarily. From siope; to be dumb; figuratively, to be calm.
